alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montgomery, northeastern Chester and north central Delaware Counties through 715 PM EDT... At 642 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glenmoore, or 10 miles northwest of West Chester, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norristown, Phoenixville, West Norriton, East Norriton, Downingtown, Collegeville, Royersford, Trappe, Schwenksville, Elverson, Pughtown, Trout Lake, Radnor Township, Lionville-Marchwood, Valley Forge, Glenmoore, Paoli, Chester Springs, Lionville and King Of Prussia. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 302 and 329. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 330. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 11 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Western Chester; Western Montgomery
